page.title: 11FARMING
page.content: Agriculture is an important occupation of many inhahitants of this area. There are variations of land usage, carfully dictated by the nearness of the sea. On the cliff land there is rough grazing for sheep, but farther inland one finds dairy, pig and arable farming. Crops grown include Barley, wheat and root crops for cattle feed. The neighbouring towns of Holsworthy and Bideford both hold weekly cattle markets. The Pannier Market in Bideford, open on Tuesday and Saturdays, provides an outlet for garden and dairy produce, as well as country crafts.
